sentence.Network_en: There were no proper toilets, but only an outdoor latrine.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有正规的厕所，只有一个位于室外的茅坑。

sentence.Network_en: Still, it has no running water and one outdoor latrine.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是, 还没有自来水和屋外的场院.

sentence.Network_en: Objective To evaluate sanitary effects on attic type composting latrine.
sentence.Network_cn: 目的评价阁楼式堆肥厕所无害化效果.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (rare before the mid 19th cent.): via French from Latin latrina, contraction of lavatrina, from lavare 'to wash'

entry.def: A latrine is a structure, usually consisting of a hole in the ground, that is used as a toilet, for example in a military camp.

example.ex: There were no proper toilets, but only an outdoor latrine...
example.tran: 没有正规的厕所，只有一个位于室外的茅坑。

example.ex: They made me clean out the latrines.

means.word_mean: 1. a public toilet in a military area

auth_sentence.content: He has fallen into the Latrine of Lament!
auth_sentence.res_content: He has fallen into the Latrine of Lament!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has fallen into the Latrine of Lament!

auth_sentence.content: But you can see I can't work in a latrine.
auth_sentence.res_content: But you can see I can't work in a latrine.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But you can see I can't work in a latrine.

auth_sentence.content: Bug-stung, starved, and running to the latrine all night.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bug-stung, starved, and running to the latrine all night.

sentences.en: They were told off to clean the latrines.
sentences.cn: 他们被逐一派去扫厕所。
